ygData.subject: Life's A Bitch!

( Carnage: Nice to know I was remembered, slightly. But now I may have a 
reason to reactivate Carnage, if Teltoli has not already found enough new 
friends?
But, if you still want the old ones�.)

** There was no point in moving from her spot to chase after some stupid 
stasis pod, it would only mean a plus sign in the population number of 
whatever faction got there first.
Carnage rolled over lazily onto her other side, remembering seeing that pod 
steak in from the sky and crash less then a click away. But the sun was high 
and warm and she had no intention on leaving the outcrop half way up the 
side of a cliff that she had spotted out and parked herself for the 
afternoon.
Her body was soaking up the heat as a sponge did water, and it felt 
wonderful.

It had been a while since she had had any contact with any of the robotic 
factions which came around this dust ball of a planet�although she had kept 
updated on everything.
Maximals had a new base and leader.
The Ark was scrap.
Predacons were supposedly staging an attack.
And the Alliance base had relocated.
Oh course, nothing that concerned her since she didn�t belong to a faction. 
And life as a solitary assassin wasn�t all that bad.

Carnage opened her mouth and yawned wide, making a small sound which might 
be heard as cute before her jaws snapped shut again. Stretching out her arms 
and shoulders, that her fingers at the end of her hands. Next were her legs 
and thigh muscles, feet and toes. Back, neck, and finally her tail, 
stretching out straight behind her.
But then she simply moved her head so that the bottom of her jaw was laying 
against the edge of the cliff, looking lazily out onto the plains while her 
body remained on it�s side. Her lazy eyes looking towards the crash site of 
the stasis pod or where it should be located.

She remembered that it had been a while ago, almost a year, that she had set 
out towards the snow-capped hills after her friend Teltoli had disappeared. 
Maybe she had been looking for something in her sadness, never showing it, 
but all she had found was frostbite!
So, she had returned to the warmer climates; raptors weren�t made for snow 
anyway.
And here she was now, no better off then she had been after Dinobot had 
died.
Alone, lonely, board, even at times�depressed.
To the Pit! She still missed him!
It had been a long time since he had passed away and still the pain was 
deep. But what else could she hope to feel when something like that hit so 
close to the spark?

Carnage rolled over onto her back, looking up into the great blue yonder, 
the occasional cloud coming into view.
She remembered�everything.
After her friend�s death she had disappeared from the Predacon all together, 
sinking into the swamps as well as she had into her sadness. From then on 
they had been her home, drifting among the mists like a deep shadow. Their 
dark and deep atmosphere feeding her sorrow until there was nothing left. 
Paling her complexion until there was nothing but dull grays and browns.
But then�one evening a pod landed just beyond her swamp, holding something 
that had changed her life�for a time.
Carnage sighed.
She lost all of her friends, one way or another.
The thought of being alone causing her to feel a stab of inner pain within 
her spark. Also feeling a bit of betrayed at being left alone like this, 
making it so that she no longer trusted. But these feelings didn�t make her 
sad, only regret.
Regret having anyone to care for in the first place.
But since Teltoli�s disappearance she had leaned not to trust again, 
becoming her old hard self.
: I could even almost chill Dinobot, if he was alive.:
Another stab of regret.
Carnage growled and flopped onto her side again, moving so that she was 
facing the rock wall and turned her back on the plains as well as the rest 
of the world.
: Who needs �em?!:
Muttering to herself in a grumpy tone, one only she could hear.**

� Life�s a bitch and then �ya die!�
